name: Deepu George
bio: Deepu completed his Integrated BS–MS dual degree in Chemistry (minor in Biology) at the Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Trivandrum (IISER TVM). His master’s work in the group of Prof. Mahesh Hariharan explored halogenation effects on supramolecular assemblies and rylene-diimide systems for singlet fission. He gained further research experience through multiple internships in physical organic chemistry and materials science, including studies on organic semiconductors and biodegradable conducting polymers. In 2024, he joined the Greenfield Group at the University of Würzburg, first as a research intern and then as a PhD student, where he is investigating light-induced non-equilibrium steady states in supramolecular systems.
education: PhD Student, University of Würzburg (Nov 2024 – Present)
M.S. Thesis, IISER TVM (2016–2021) – Major in Chemistry, Minor in Biology
awards: INSPIRE Scholar, Department of Science and Technology (DST), India (2016–2021)

publications.title: Charge Transport through Discrete Crystalline Architectures
The effect of Single Atom Substitution on the Structure and Bandgap of Organic Semiconductors
Atom Efficient Halogen-Halogen Interactions Assist One-, Two- and Three-Dimensional Molecular Zippers
